titleStmt.title: Digital Edition of Glaser Abklatsch ID: AT-OeAW-BA-3-27-P-270
AT-OeAW-BA-3-27-P-270

item.term: Early first millennium to the fourth century BC (predominance of Saba)
Fourth to first centuries BC (predominance of Qataban and Hadramawt, and their alliance with Main)
First century BC to early second century AD (alliances between the tribes of the high plateau and the ASA kingdoms)
Late second to late third centuries AD (wars among the Himyar, Saba and Hadramawt)
Fourth to sixth centuries AD (unification of Yemen under Himyarite rule)
It corresponds to the palaeographical divisions established by Jacques Ryckmans with sub-periods I-IV
First sub-period of the palaeographical divisions established by Jacques Ryckmans
Second sub-period of the palaeographical divisions established by Jacques Ryckmans
Second sub-period of the palaeographical divisions established by Jacques Ryckmans
Second sub-period of the palaeographical divisions established by Jacques Ryckmans
Third sub-period of the palaeographical divisions established by Jacques Ryckmans
Fourth sub-period of the palaeographical divisions established by Jacques Ryckmans
Fourth sub-period of the palaeographical divisions established by Jacques Ryckmans

div.tei:ab: 1.šhr | ġyln | bn | ʾbšbm | mlk | qtbn | w-kl | wld | ʿm | w-ʾwsn | w-kḥd | w-dhsm | w-tbnw | bkr | ʾnby | w-ḥwkm | ḏ-ʾmr | w-šmr | qẓr | qyn | ršw | ʿmm | bny | w-sḥdṯ | kl | mbny | w-mhlk 2.ḫlfn ḏ-śdw | w-nmr-sww | ḥmrr | w-šḫb | ʾbn-s | w-blq-s | w-ʿḍ-s | w-mrt-[s ... ...] b-mnšʾ | qtbn | b-ʿṯtr | w-b | ʿm | w-b | ʾnby | w-b | ḏt | ṣntm | w-b | ḏt | ẓhrn

ḫlfn ḏ-śdw | w-nmr-sww | ḥmrr | w-šḫb | ʾbn-s | w-blq-s | w-ʿḍ-s | w-mrt-s b-mnšʾ | qtbn | b-ʿṯtr | w-b | ʿm | w-b | ʾnby | w-b | ḏt | ṣntm | w-b | ḏt | ẓhrn

šhr ġyln bn ʾbšbm mlk qtbn w-kl wld ʿm w-ʾwsn w-kḥd w-dhsm w-tbnw bkr ʾnby w-ḥwkm ḏ-ʾmr w-šmr qẓr qyn ršw ʿmm bny w-sḥdṯ kl mbny w-mhlk
ḫlfn ḏ-śdw w-nmr-sww ḥmrr w-šḫb ʾbn-s w-blq-s w-ʿḍ-s w-mrt-s b-mnšʾ qtbn b-ʿṯtr w-b ʿm w-b ʾnby w-b ḏt ṣntm w-b ḏt ẓhrn

1.Shahr Ghaylān bin ʾAbīshabam, King of Qatabān and all the Children of ʿAmm and ʾAwsān and Kaḥid and Dahasum and Tubanū, the First-Born of ʾAnbay and Ḥawkam Dhū-ʾAmīr and Shammar, collector and qayn-official and priest of ʿAmmum, has built and restored the entire construction and edifice 2.of the gate of Śadū and its pylons, Ḥamrir and Shukhab, (with) its stone and its lime-plaster and its wood and [its] limestone, with the labor of of Qatabān. By ʿAthtar and by ʿAmm and by ʾAnbay and by Dhāat-Ṣanatam and by Dhāt-Ẓahrān.

Shahr Ghaylān bin ʾAbīshabam, King of Qatabān and all the Children of ʿAmm and ʾAwsān and Kaḥid and Dahasum and Tubanū, the First-Born of ʾAnbay and Ḥawkam Dhū-ʾAmīr and Shammar, collector and qayn-official and priest of ʿAmmum, has built and restored the entire construction and edifice
of the gate of Śadū and its pylons, Ḥamrir and Shukhab, with its stone and its lime-plaster and its wood and its limestone, with the labor of of Qatabān. By ʿAthtar and by ʿAmm and by ʾAnbay and by Dhāat-Ṣanatam and by Dhāt-Ẓahrān.

Shahr Ghaylān bin ʾAbīshabam, King of Qatabān and all the Children of ʿAmm and ʾAwsān and Kaḥid and Dahasum and Tubanū, the First-Born of ʾAnbay and Ḥawkam Dhū-ʾAmīr and Shammar, collector and qayn-official and priest of ʿAmmum, has built and restored the entire construction and edifice
of the gate of Śadū and its pylons, Ḥamrir and Shukhab, with its stone and its lime-plaster and its wood and its limestone, with the labor of of Qatabān. By ʿAthtar and by ʿAmm and by ʾAnbay and by Dhāat-Ṣanatam and by Dhāt-Ẓahrān.

Shahr Ghaylān bin ʾAbīshabam, King of Qatabān and all the Children of ʿAmm and ʾAwsān and Kaḥid and Dahasum and Tubanū, the First-Born of ʾAnbay and Ḥawkam Dhū-ʾAmīr and Shammar, collector and qayn-official and priest of ʿAmmum, has built and restored the entire construction and edifice
of the gate of Śadū and its pylons, Ḥamrir and Shukhab, with its stone and its lime-plaster and its wood and its limestone, with the labor of of Qatabān. By ʿAthtar and by ʿAmm and by ʾAnbay and by Dhāat-Ṣanatam and by Dhāt-Ẓahrān.

bibl.seg: Avanzini, Alessandra 1995. As-Sawdāʾ. Inventaire des inscriptions sudarabiques. 4. Paris: de Boccard / Rome: Herder. [Académie des Inscriptions et Belles-lettres; Istituto italiano per l'Africa e l'Oriente]
